item.content:encoded: my $row = $db->insert($args); pre_insert: ($db, $args, $table_name) post_insert: ($db, $row, $table_name) my $updated_rows_count = $db->update($args); my $updated_rows_count = $row->update(); # example $args: +{ id => $row->id } pre_update: ($db, $ar [...]

item.title: Renee Baecker: Perl Ecosystem Group
item.author: Renee Baecker
item.content:encoded:
Zusammen mit Gabor Szabo habe ich die Perl Ecosystem Group gestartet. Diese Organisation soll die Verbindung zwischen Unternehmen, die Perl einsetzen, und der Perl Community verbessern.

Unsere Ziele sind:
  • Unternehmen helfen mehr gute Perl-Programmierer [...]

item.title: Gabor Szabo (szabgab): Perl Ecosystem Group
item.author: Gabor Szabo (szabgab)
item.content:encoded: Finally it is happening. Renee Baecker and myself have established the Perl Ecosystem Group. We have several items on our agenda such as Helping companies to be better connected to the Perl community. Helping companies to find more good Perl develope [...]

item.title: chromatic: Composability, Scoping, and Non-Interference
item.author: chromatic
item.content:encoded: Perl 5's flexibility allows the CPAN to exist and CPAN's flexibility allows Perl 5 to evolve. Where would Perl be without the DBI or TAP? Imagine using Perl 5 without LWP or Moose or Perl::Critic. Even so, the difference between...

item.title: f00li5h: Wrapping An OO module in a procedural API using Exporter::Simple
item.author: f00li5h
item.content:encoded:
Object Oriented Programming: An idiom in which you capture behaviour along with state with interlated types.

I like procedural APIs. I'm not sorry about that. OO is a hammer, and sometimes I want to put in a screw, simple.

An example...

CPAN.pm is a goo [...]

item.title: vti: Perl, WebSockets and VNC in your browser
item.author: vti
item.content:encoded: Here is a video a made up to show that it is possible to run a VNC client in your browser! Perl + WebSockets + VNC Source code is available on GitHub http://github.com/vti/showmethedesktop.

item.content:encoded: A couple of days ago our request for a Perl devroom was accepted by the FOSDEM organizers. This means we are going to have a room on Sunday, 6th February from 9:00-17:00 where we can organize Perl related talks. The room has 72 seats and the expected [...]

item.title: Dan Bolser (faceface): Problems with your local perl install?
item.author: Dan Bolser (faceface)
item.content:encoded:
Try the following uber 1337 commands:

mv ~/perl5 ~/notperl5
wget -O - http://cpanmin.us | perl - -L ~/perl5 --self-upgrade local::lib


ZOMG!



OK, now add your ~/perl5 dir into git...
cd ~/perl5/ ; git init ; git add . ; git commit -m 'initial import'

This wi [...]
